sourceMeaningMnemonic: The <radical>leader</radical> says <radical>spring</radical> is looking <radical>dry</radical>, so you'll need your <kanji>salary</kanji> in advance.
meaningInfo: The leader shows you the number, it's all of your salary for spring. "This way, if things dry up worse, you'll be okay for a while," he says. This is awfully nice, but very suspicious at the same time.
readingMnemonic: Your <kanji>salary</kanji> is sent straight to your <reading>ho</reading>me (<ja>ほう</ja>) instead of the bank. Okay, something is definitely fishy here.
readingInfo:
You're sitting at home, and there is a knock at the door. A man in a suit, hat, and dark sunglasses hands you a briefcase full of money. "Here's your spring salary. Enjoy the dry weather."

"T-thanks?"

Welp, have fun at home with your stacks of early salary cash.
